title: BBC Local Live: Coventry and Warwickshire - BBC News
summary: families pay tribute to teenagers killed in atherstone crash .
witnesses sought over death of man arrested by police .
kos holidaymaker scared for his life .

documents.title: whiteley six sixes in vain after willey ton
text: whiteley six sixes in vain after willey ton

documents.title: parade marks mod depot 's 75th anniversary
text: parade marks mod depot 's 75th anniversary

documents.title: wessels hits ton , pietersen injured again
text: wessels hits ton , pietersen injured again

documents.title: death probe man 'ill in police presence '
text: death probe man 'ill in police presence '

documents.title: our coverage across the week
text: we 're back from 08:00 on monday .
join us then .

documents.title: academies planned to bridge skills gap
text: new technical academies are planned in warwickshire and birmingham as part of a £ 6m plan to help train engineering apprentices .
warwickshire-based machine tool maker engineering technology group said it was working with bike manufacturer norton to help train 300 young engineers over the next two or three years .
the companies are hoping to open a total of 15 centres across the uk to train and supply the next generation of engineering apprentices for the british motorcycle industry .
the first facility has just launched at norton motorcycles in castle donington .
the current education platform is broken and not relevant to the world we operate in .
instead of bemoaning our luck and lack of support , we 've decided to do something about it with the launch of our national network . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plans to build student flats near town centre approved
text: councillors have approved plans to build student flats near leamington town centre .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: watch : warnings of heavy rain and high winds for the west midlands
text: the heavy rain will clear eastwards through the early hours on saturday .
by dawn clear spells will develop , with light winds .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: sky blues fixtures released for efl trophy campaign
text: fixture and ticket details have been confirmed ahead of the sky blues ' efl trophy defence .
mark robins ' side will start their campaign at the ricoh arena against league one side shrewsbury town on 29 august , before a trip to face walsall at the banks 's stadium in october .

the sky blues will complete their group e fixtures against west bromwich albion under-23s at the ricoh arena on tuesday 7november , as they look to defend the competition they won at wembley last season .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: ipcc : man died days after becoming unwell in police presence
text: a man who died in hospital after being arrested became unwell at premises to which police were called , says the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
the police watchdog said on july 10 , officers were called to a residence in edward street , nuneaton , by a person concerned about the behaviour of darren cumberbatch , 32 .
it said it understood that a short time later , he was taken to nearby george eliot hospital - where he died on july 19 .
investigators have spoken to witnesses and cctv from the premises is being reviewed .
the ipcc also wants to see cctv footage from the hospital .
mr cumberbatch 's family has urged witnesses with relevant information to contact the watchdog .
family members also encourage that speculation over the circumstances surrounding the death be avoided - something for which the ipcc also called , particularly on social media .

documents.title: cctv image released over rugby assault
text: a man was treated in hospital after being assaulted by an unknown assailant in rugby last week .
police have released an image of a man they wish to identify in connection with the incident in which a man in his 60s was hit on the head .
it happened in castle street at about 18:55 on 14 july .

documents.title: rising community care 'better value '
text: the spending on supported living accommodation for vulnerable adults in warwickshire has almost doubled in the past three years , according to new figures .

figures seen by bbc coventry and warwickshire show in 2014/15 the council spent £ 10.4m pounds on getting people to live in the community rather than in care homes - that has risen to almost £ 19m in the last financial year .
portfolio holder for health and adults services at warwickshire county council les caborne said the move to care for people independently at home is better value for council tax payers .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: security driver from coventry who stole co-op cash found by his dad faces jail
text: a security firm driver who kept cash he had collected from three co-op stores was caught after his father discovered some of the cash in the boot of his son 's car .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: crash teens had been on snowdonia trip
text: crash teens had been on snowdonia trip

documents.title: 'we want to do what we know we can do '
text: 'we want to do what we know we can do '

documents.title: broadhurst has work to do at royal birkdale
text: warwickshire 's other competitor at the open this week , atherstone 's paul broadhurst , teed off his second round at royal birkdale four hours after andy sullivan .
the former ryder cup player 's job will be to repair the damage of an opening-day five-over-par 75 , knowing he needs to shoot under par to stand any chance of making the halfway cut .
the 51-year-old reigning british seniors open champion might have his best days behind him .
but he has done well in the united states this year on their champions tour - and he remains a highly competitive individual .
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport at Royal Birkdale

documents.title: protesters join forces over local plan threat
text: on the front page this week : almost 300 people linked hands to form a `` human chain '' last weekend in protest over houses planned to be built in and around burton green on green belt land .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: student helps survivors who fled isis
text: a university student from iraq is helping thousands of survivors who fled the brutality of isis - all while studying for a degree in coventry .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: atherstone crash : family 'ca n't comprehend ' life without beloved son
text: the family of william louch say they 've been left `` devastated '' by the death of their `` beloved son '' but took `` great comfort '' knowing he had enjoyed an `` amazing weekend with his friends '' before a crash near atherstone that killed two others .
the car in which they were travelling hit a tree and they died at the scene .
a fourth teenager who was in the car is recovering from his injuries .
`` he already is hugely missed and we do n't even know how to start to comprehend the rest of our lives without him , '' a family statement said .
an 18-year-old woman , travelling in another vehicle , has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .
she has been released under investigation , police say .

documents.title: atherstone crash : mother 's devastation at losing 'remarkable and cherished ' daughter
text: elaine kennell says her life has been `` destroyed beyond repair '' by the death of her `` precious , beloved '' daughter trudi mae in a car crash near atherstone .
she described her as `` absolutely beautiful inside and out '' and said `` whenever she walked into a room it lit up with her fun , laughter and infectious smile '' .
trudi mae died alongside her boyfriend ryan barber .
mrs kennell said since meeting ryan , trudi mae was the `` happiest myself and her family have ever seen her '' and the pair had talked about marriage and children .
she said : `` her family , that she loved so much , have lost a remarkable and cherished granddaughter , niece and cousin . ''

documents.title: atherstone crash : 'ryan and trudi mae will be together with their angel wings '
text: the mother of ryan barber who died with his girlfriend and friend in a car crash near atherstone last weekend said he was the `` most beautiful baby , toddler and teenager '' and `` beautiful man that any mother could wish for '' .
tammi garcia sanchez said his smile was `` enough to brighten anyone 's day '' .
his father david barber said the group had climbed snowdon , camped overnight and was returning home when the crash happened on sunday .
he said a part of him had now gone forever .
according to family , ryan and partner trudi mae kennell had been together for 18 months , with ryan 's mum saying they shared the `` purest , deepest love anyone could ever hope to find '' .
she said : `` ryan and trudi mae will be together forever with their angel wings . ''

documents.title: flights on path to breaking record
text: national air traffic services says it expects to handle a record-breaking 8,800 flights today
it comes as birmingham airport anticipates a 12 % percent rise in passengers over the next three days compared to the same period last year .
more than 130,000 people are due to fly in and out of the city , with the school holidays playing a part .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: families pay tribute to teenagers killed in car crash
text: the families of three teenagers killed in a car crash at the weekend say they 've been left devastated at losing such `` beautiful '' and `` cherished '' people .
ryan barber , 19 , trudi mae kennell , 18 , and william louch , 18 , ( left to right ) died at the scene near atherstone on sunday .
an 18 year old who was a passenger in the car , named locally as dan wale , is continuing to recover from his injuries , police say .

documents.title: 'positions of trust ' sex offences on the rise in warwickshire
text: sex offences by adults in a position of trust are on the rise in warwickshire - and a children 's charity believes the true extent of abuse is much worse than official data shows .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: world para-athletics championships : third medal for kare adenegan
text: coventry wheelchair athlete kare adenegan has won her third medal of the world para-athletics championships in london .
she won bronze in the t34 400m , with teammate hannah cockroft winning her third gold of the games .
that means britain has won 28 medals , including 13 gold , and is third behind leaders china ( 18 golds ) and the us ( 15 ) .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: coventry family thrown off ryanair flight and left stranded
text: a coventry family were hauled off a ryanair flight by spanish police - more than 1,100 miles from their gran canaria holiday destination - after an argument with passengers who they claim were banging on their children 's seats .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: kos holidaymaker describes earthquake as scared-for-your-life moment
text: a coventry holidaymaker has described the moment an earthquake struck turkish and greek tourist resorts on the aegean sea as like `` something out of a film '' .
two people have been killed and at least 100 others injured on the greek island of kos .
tom perry-fox , currently on holiday there , said `` the whole room was moving , the bed was moving '' .
`` it was definitely a frightening , scared-for-your-life moment . ''

documents.title: fundraising page set up for atherstone crash families
text: friends of three teenagers who were killed when their car hit a tree near atherstone on sunday are to climb snowdon to raise money for the families affected .
ryan barber and trudi-mae kennell died at the scene along with a third teenager named locally as will louch .
a passenger named locally as dan wale was injured .
friends said they died following a weekend of walking in snowdonia and would be taking pebbles decorated with messages to place at the summit .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how i got a first at university
text: the number of first-class degrees being awarded by uk universities is on the increase , with firsts now more common than a 2:2 .
the university of warwick handed them out to 28.7 % of students last year , up from 25.5 % five years ago .
khadijah lewis , 22 , who got a first in history and sociology at the university of warwick , said she found her course `` tough '' but made sure her social life did n't stop .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: sullivan in contention at the open
text: nuneaton 's andy sullivan will tee off in the second round of the open championship at royal birkdale handily placed after shooting level par on the first day .
after carding two birdies and an eagle at the long 17th , the 31-year-old ryder cup player told bbc sport : `` it 's been two years since i won an event .
but i feel like my game has really come back to where it was when i started winning .
i 've been putting myself on the right side of the leaderboard the last four or five weeks now .
`` i had a little bit of spell where life off the course was getting a little bit too much for me .
i 've just sort of found my way back again and now i 'm happier off the course .
and to get that eagle on 17 was crucial to keep myself in it . ''
sullivan , who is playing with the netherlands ' joost luiten and american david lipsky teed off in round two at 08:14 .
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport at Royal Birkdale

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: some bright spells around today but a band of rain will move in later which could be heavy at times , with top temperatures of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates have now ended for coventry and warwickshire .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 tomorrow with the usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather .
in the meantime keep an eye out for breaking stories .

documents.title: video : coventry 's city of culture bid team
text: meet the team tasked with getting us to the winning line in the competition to become the uk 's city of culture 2021 .
author: Chanise Evans
BBC Online

documents.title: cctv images released after wallet theft
text: police investigating the theft of a wallet in warwick have released cctv of a woman they would like to speak to .
the victim 's card was taken in all saints road just after midnight on sunday 18 june , and is believed to have been used for several transactions .

documents.title: mp nadhim zahawi told to calm down in parliament
text: speaker of the house of commons , john bercow , reprimanded the out-of-order tory mp for 'gesticulating in a distinctly eccentric manner ' adding shakespeare 's county deserves better !
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: assistant manager parts company with boro
text: nuneaton have confirmed steve chettle has left his role as assistant manager to join ilkeston .
the former nottingham forest defender had been with the boro since 2015 .
breaking : assistant manager , steve chettle , has today departed boro - further details here :
good luck to a legend @ twitterid # uptheboro
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: weather : heavy rain for several days
text: we might have some showers tonight and over the next three days we are forecast some heavy rain .
it will remain warm though , with temperatures as high as 15c ( 59f ) overnight .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: coventry mp urges government to consider stalking register
text: coventry south mp jim cunningham has urged the government to look at introducing a stalking register .
he was urged to act by one of his constituents , zoe dronfield , who was subjected to a brutal eight hour attack by a former partner .

she now campaigns for legislation that could protect women from serial stalkers and domestic violence perpetrators by introducing a register which would enable police to identify , track , monitor and manage stalkers .
today , i urged the govt to legislate for the introduction of a stalking register as a matter of urgency @ twitterid @ twitterid
i agree with the sentiment however the `` two women a week '' thing is a lie , you have reseachers at hand use them .
stop spreading lies !
the stalkers register is not just for women .
you are right it 's not 2 women a week , it 's more .
really ?
any actual evidence to back up that claim
yes and he 's a question for you .
why are you posing as a women ?
this is women killed by men not partner or ex partner .
and your point is ?
my point is 2 women a week are not killed by a partner or ex partner .
the number last year was 77 women and 28 men .
ok , yr a women but you question women 's rights ?
and to reiterate the stalkers register is not gender biased .
look at fig 2.5 only way it adds up to 2 a week is if you mislead by adding 28 men into that number ,
this is unaceptable , it ignores male victims and paints a false of abuse .
stop ignoring men and using them as tools to push agenda .
just speaking the truth .
i ca n't stand these lies and blatant disregard for victims
indeed , the latest attempt is to get dv legislated as a gendered crime .
ask yourself why ?
who stands to benefit ?
not the victims .
it 's not the system that benefits it 's the feminist led orgs that have made dv a good business model , a multi million pound industry .
great , we need votes to implement this i urge every party to get behind this campaign
who would go on a register ?
all those convicted of stalking ?
well the guidelines would need to be established but those who are serial offenders .
we need to be proactive !
as determined by a court presumably , not the police ?
we do n't even have the legislation yet so it would be premature to comment .
how does one contribute ?

documents.title: jobs at coventry plant 'secured ' by takeover
text: around 230 jobs at a processing plant in coventry have been secured after the company was taken over .
uk steel firm liberty house has bought amtek uk , which has a factory in coventry processing aluminium and iron components for engines and transmissions .
liberty say it bought the business , which also has sites in kidderminster and witham in essex , for `` an undisclosed sum '' from administrators .
earlier this year the comany also acquired automotive supplier covpress in a deal securing 740 skilled workers ' jobs at a plant in canley , coventry .

documents.title: 'wellbeing campus ' plan for the eliot ?
text: you can find all of our main stories on the nuneaton news website .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: £ 2m bid to restore historic cemetery
text: coventry 's london rd cemetery , one of the top five historic cemeteries in the country , is bidding to get further grant support from the heritage lottery fund to help with restoration works .
the city council says £ 2m is needed to restore the site to architect joseph paxton 's original design .
the scheme would include repairing major features such as the anglican chapel , key monument and entrance as well as horticultural and tree works .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry couple scoop £ 1m on euromillions
text: a coventry couple who worked together as chefs have been unveiled as £ 1m winners of the euromillions .
bill mullarkey , 57 , and his wife cath , 56 , plan to split their time between coventry and the caribbean after the win they described as a `` dream come true '' .

documents.title: the specials ' horace panter re-united with loved and lost 'ghost town ' bass
text: a coventry musical icon has been unexpectedly re-united after decades with the guitar he loved and lost - used in the recording of the still much celebrated specials number 1 single 'ghost town ' .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: university first class degrees soaring
text: the proportion of top degree grades being awarded by uk universities has soared - with some universities giving first class degrees to more than a third of their students .
the university of warwick awarded a first class degree to 28.7 % of students last year , up from 25.5 % five years ago .

the press association survey , analysing figures for 2015-16 from the higher education statistics agency ( hesa ) , indicates it is now more common to graduate with a first-class degree than a lower second ( 2:2 ) grade - with 24 % getting a first last year , compared with 21 % getting a lower second .
the most widely awarded degree was an upper second ( 2:1 ) , received by about 51 %

documents.title: blind couple recognised by university
text: a blind couple from kenilworth who 've been married 50 years have been awarded joint honorary degrees for services to their community .
fred and etta reid , who both lost their sight in childhood , have worked tirelessly to help others with disabilities .
the parents of three were recognised for their achievements by the university of warwick .

documents.title: in warwickshire floods 10 years on
text: ten years ago today devastating floods hit warwickshire and the west midlands .
thousands of homes were left under water with alcester , stratford-upon-avon and leamington spa badly affected .
since then the government has spent nearly £ 6bn improving flood defences for almost 500,000 homes across the country .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crime up in coventry and warwickshire
text: the latest crime figures for england and wales show there was a 19 % increase in offences reported to the police in warwickshire for the year to the end of march .
recorded crime has also risen by 11 % in the west midlands .

the police and crime commissioner for the west midlands , david jamieson describes the figures as a `` major concern '' and said the figures were `` further evidence the government needs to change course on police funding '' .
across the country there was an 18 % rise in violent crime .

documents.title: ipcc investigation : man at centre died in hospital , police said
text: the man at the centre of the ipcc investigation - who died after being arrested - was a 32-year-old from nuneaton , warwickshire police said .
in a statement the force said he was arrested after they were called to an incident in edward street in the town at around 00:25 on monday 10 july .
`` as the officers were concerned for his welfare he was taken to george eliot hospital where he was admitted as a patient and subsequently de-arrested '' , a statement said .
`` on 11 july 2017 , his condition deteriorated and he was transferred to itu .
he sadly died in the early hours of wednesday 19 july 2017 . ''
the force said they are `` very saddened to hear of the death of this man '' and offered `` deepest sympathies '' to his family .

documents.title: birmingham airport to keep american flights
text: a new low-cost airline is going to start transatlantic flights from birmingham airport to new york and boston from next may .
just last week it was revealed united airlines are pulling out of the airport , with flights to newark ending in october .
primera air will operate daily flights to new york , and four a week to boston .

documents.title: hopes to fill vacant shops as swan centre sold for more than £ 3m
text: the new shopping and dining complex in rugby has been sold in a deal worth more than £ 3m with hopes the vacant units will be filled soon .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: ipcc probe death of nuneaton man after arrest
text: the death of a man arrested by warwickshire police earlier this month is being investigated by the police watchdog .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) spokesman said the independent investigation was launched after a man was arrested in the nuneaton area on 10 july .
the ipcc said they understand that soon after the arrest he was taken to hospital where he remained in a serious condition .
`` police were informed of his death yesterday , '' it said , `` and subsequently referred the matter to us .
`` our investigation will look at the circumstances of the man 's death and the contact police had with him . ''

documents.title: andy sullivan in open action this afternoon
text: nuneaton 's andy sullivan will tee-off at 13:15 in today 's open .
he 's partnered with dutchman joost luiten and american david lipsky at the royal birkdale event .
you can follow live updates on today 's action here .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: tributes paid to tragic teenagers
text: family and friends of three teenagers killed in a tragic accident on sunday , have paid heartfelt tributes to the youngsters .
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: floods 2007 : record rainfall in the west midlands
text: here are some of the startling figures around the flooding that hit the west midlands 10 years ago .

documents.title: coventry children urged to take up reading challenge
text: children between the age of 4 and 11 to borrow and read six book during the summer holidays .
it 's all part of 'the summer reading challenge ' which aims to prevent children 's literacy skills from dipping over the school holidays .
coventry 's libraries are taking part .

the summer reading challenge is a fantastic way of getting children to keep reading over the summer holidays we 'll also be getting young people involved as volunteers in libraries , and we 've got a preschool challenge for younger readers .

documents.title: plans for student accommodation on site of old listed coventry hospital
text: the long-standing victorian buildings of the old listed coventry and warwickshire hospital are to be transformed .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: domestic violence offenders to get help from new scheme
text: a new programme is being launched today to help people who abuse their partners get help .
the £ 1m scheme is being rolled out by the west midlands police and crime commissioner david jamieson .
offenders will work with a domestic violence charity for 30 weeks to change their behaviour .
their partners and children will also be helped .

documents.title: warwickshire mp re-elected as parliamentary group chair
text: the mp for north warwickshire and bedworth craig tracey has taken to twitter to announce his reappointment as chair of the all party parliamentary group on insurance and financial services .
delighted to have been re-elected as chair of all party parliamentary group on insurance & finacial services .
lots of interesting to
congrats craig !
be good to catch up
congratulations craig on your re-election
that 's great as i might desperately need your advice .

documents.title: drivers warned after crash closes road
text: a serious accident has closed wedgnock lane in warwick between cape road and a425 birmingham road , police say .
wedgnock lane , warwick closed between cape rd and birmingham rd due to an accident .
please seek alternative route .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: coventry woman questioned over terror offences
text: detectives are continuing to question an 18-year-old coventry woman who was arrested earlier in the week on sus of terrorism offences .
the woman was detained on tuesday on sus of being concerned in the commission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism .
she 's being questioned by the west midlands counter terrorism unit at a police station in the region .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy and wet start we can expect a fresher brighter afternoon , with some sunny spells and highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 24 hours in england
text: 24 hours in england

documents.title: our coverage for the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: grade-ii listed coventry hospital set to become massive students flats complex
text: more student accommodation is set to be built on the site of the listed coventry and warwickshire hospital .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: weather : more rain to come and a warm night
text: we could see some more rain this evening , but it 's going to remain warm overnight - with temperatures as high as 15c ( 59f ) .
and looks like it 's going to be a wet end to the week .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: football : penny heads leaves the boro for peterborough in club record deal
text: nuneaton town has announced alex penny has moved to league one side peterborough united for a club record fee .
the 20-year-old defender is one of a number of boro players invited to jamie vardy 's v9 academy for non-league players earlier this summer .
he becomes the third nuneaton player to link up with peterborough in the past 18 months .
author: Mikey Burrows
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: appeal for witnesses after burglary at alcester shop
text: police are seeking information about a burglary at tesco express in alcester in the early hours of wednesday morning .
officers attended the scene - in hopkins precinct - to find four people leaving the shop in a light blue bmw m3 .
a 20-year-man and a 16-year-old boy were arrested on sus of burglary .
they are both in custody .
officers are now asking eyewitnesses with information about the two remaining offenders to come forward .

documents.title: two taken to hospital after car crash in kenilworth this morning
text: two patients have been taken to hospital after two cars were involved in a crash in kenilworth on wednesday morning .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: anglers issued illegal fishing fines
text: police officers teamed up with the angling trust , the environment agency and the rural crime coordinator for warwickshire to check anglers using water courses and fisheries for licenses .
eight water courses were visited - including ones in wolvey , rugby and coombe abbey - resulting in seven anglers being issued with penalties .
we are very aware of the impact anti-social behaviour and illegal angling can have on the local community and area .
working in partnership is key , it allows us to have a strong presence for the public 's safety and to protect the waterways and prevent further anti-social behaviour and fish theft .

documents.title: the rise and rise of bare-knuckle boxing
text: the rise and rise of bare-knuckle boxing

documents.title: coventry woman to be questioned further
text: detectives have been granted more time to question an 18-year-old coventry woman who was arrested yesterday on sus of terrorism offences .
the woman was arrested on sus of being concerned in the comission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism .
she continues to be questioned by the west midlands counter terrorism unit at a police station in the region .

documents.title: olympic gold medal winner launches jousting season
text: olympic champion victoria pendleton has put her jousting skills to the test in warwickshire .
the gold medal-winning cyclist donned a suit of armour and a 12ft lance as she was put through her paces during a special training session at kenilworth castle .
it was all part of the launch of english heritage 's `` medieval knights season '' and follows calls by the charity to make jousting an olympic sport .
i 've seen at first-hand how physically fit you need to be to joust and the sheer skill and strength involved .
it 's just as physically exerting as competitive cycling or horse-racing .
jousting definitely deserves its place at the olympic table .

documents.title: campaign under way to save school farm
text: a petition has been launched to try and reverse a decision to close a farm in the grounds of a coventry school .
it follows last week 's announcement by cardinal wiseman catholic school that it was no longer going to offer qualifications in agricultural studies .
the school says it will instead put more emphasis on subjects like maths and science .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: 24 hours in england : air ambulance
text: ian lock , 42 , is a critical care paramedic for midlands air ambulance .
he has been with the service since 2009 when he joined because he wanted a new challenge .

on his first mission he remembers going to a road accident in coventry and recalls : `` all the existing guys who 'd been on for a while were so calm and i was a bit like a new boy with wide eyes thinking what on earth have i done , why am i here and how am i here and how i am going catch up with them ? ''
mr lock is in our 24 hours in england feature - where we take a look at people going about their lives .
use # 24hoursinengland on social media to share your stories .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: councils thanked for small business support
text: small businesses across the west midlands have been supported by their local councils .
now , the councils have been rewarded for the support they have shown .

warwick district , nuneaton and bedworth borough , solihull metropolitan and warwickshire county council have all been recognised for the work they 've done to make it easier for small businesses to thrive .
it 's part of the annual federation of small businesses local authority awards

documents.title: coventry woman arrested on sus of terror offences
text: an 18-year-old coventry woman has been arrested on sus of terrorism offences .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: speaker : shakespeare 's county deserves better
text: speaker : shakespeare 's county deserves better

documents.title: contaminated blood inquiry backed
text: a government inquiry into the contaminated blood scandal that left at least 2,400 people dead , has been welcomed .
the inquiry was announced last week in a bid to establish why many nhs patients were given infected blood products from abroad in the 1970s and 1980s .
rugby mp mark pawsey welcomed the news while in parliament .
delighted the government will be holding an inquiry into # contaminatedblood & hope it will address wider challenges
enquiry long overdue .
well done for getting the go ahead
the truth can not be withheld any longer we owe it to the victims who died & the families that grieve that the truth is told
it 's not @ twitterid @ twitterid not listening 2 victims & families # contaminatedblood 1 month on no chair & @ twitterid still influencing

documents.title: drug operation lands ten in court
text: ten people will appear in court next month following an investigation into the alleged supply of drugs from birmingham into leamington spa and warwick .
police say nine of the ten people set to appear at warwickshire magistrates court on 9 august have been charged with conspiracy to supply crack cocaine and herorin .
in addition , a 44-year-old man from kenilworth has been requisitioned to appear in court where he will face charges of conspiracy to supply drugs .

documents.title: football : honours even between the brakes and the racers
text: racing club warwick earned themselves a pre-season draw against leamington on tuesday night .
the result meant that both clubs shared the tony horley cancer charity cup .
the brakes came from behind to rescue the game from the penalty spot late into the second half .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: prime minister invited to 'move government ' to the city
text: theresa may has been asked if she would consider moving her government to coventry .
coventry north west mp geoffrey robinson was speaking at the final prime minister 's questions before the summer recess .
mrs may says while she enjoys visiting the west midlands , she is n't considering shifting the government 's base from westminster .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: paterson case referred to court of appeal
text: the attorney general 's office has confirmed the case of ian paterson has been referred to the court of appeal for being `` unduly lenient '' .
a statement said the solicitor general had referred the case under the unduly lenient sentence scheme .
the former breast cancer surgeon , 59 , was jailed for 15 years in may after carrying out unnecessary operations on nine women and one man at hospitals in the west midlands .
sentencing him mr justice jeremy baker said he had deliberately preyed on his patients long-term fears and manipulated them .
his case will be heard at the court of appeal on 3 august .

documents.title: 'shakespeare 's county deserves better '
text: nadhim zahawi has been reprimanded for `` gesticulating '' during prime minister 's question time .
the conservative mp for stratford-upon-avon was rebuked by the commons speaker john bercow while the labour leader jeremy corbyn was speaking .
the honourable gentleman for stratford-upon-avon is gesticulating in a distinctly eccentric manner and he must stop doing so !
shakespeare 's county deserves better .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: work underway to prevent cancer hair loss
text: research - being supported by warwick university and coventry 's university hospital - is aiming to find a way of stopping cancer patients from losing their hair during treatment .
it 's hoped a new scalp cooling technique will reduce the hair loss caused by chemotherapy .
we think the scalp cooling works by constricting the blood vessels so that the chemotherapy does n't get through to the scalp .

documents.title: baby box 'giveaway ' for newborns
text: more than a hundred new and expectant parents are expected to attend the launch of a baby box service at the transport museum in coventry today .
the boxes - made from thick cardboard lined with a foam mattress - are designed to be used as a baby 's bed in the first few months .
they will be given out pre-assembled at the launch event today before continuing to be distributed for free at hospitals across coventry and warwickshire in the future .
we will encourage every new mother in the region to sign up to the baby box university site and receive a baby box .
this will help us to educate new parents on the importance of safe sleeping practices , as well as other important to like smoking in pregnancy .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: breast surgeon who 'played god with women ' faces longer behind bars
text: rogue surgeon ian paterson could face having his prison term increased .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: stratford hospital ward closed to visitors
text: the nhs trust that runs stratford hospital has closed the nicol unit to visitors due to an outbreak of norovirus .
people are being advised to call the hospital beforehand if they 're seeking a visit on compassionate grounds .
the nicol unit is the immediate care ward .
@ strathospital 's nicol unit is closed to visitors due to norovirus .
visiting is allowed on compassionate grounds only , plse call beforehand

documents.title: former liverpool fc u-21s star ends coventry city trial
text: former liverpool fc academy star jordan lussey has failed to earn a deal at coventry city .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: campaign bids to help soldiers 'adjust ' to civilan life
text: a company in coventry has launched a campaign to help soldiers once they return home from duty .
the wigley group is raising money to retrain serviceman in a bid to help them transition back into civilian life .
[ one soldier ] is currently doing a degree in cyber security in coventry , but we 're also supporting two others to help [ them ] progress through into civilian life .

documents.title: businesses 'concerned ' over future of coventry airport
text: businesses based at coventry airport say they 're worried about the long term future of the site after it was temporarily closed to all air traffic on monday .
it follows a decision last month to change the way the airport operates - which included a reduction in opening hours .
airport officials have now met with company owners that operate there .
we 're cancelling peoples flights , we 're sending them home , we 're losing thousands of pounds per week and the reputation 's getting a bashing as well .
author: Trish Adudu
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry sphinx future secured
text: the future of coventry sphinx has been secured after a new 25-year lease at sphinx drive was agreed .
work to improve the ground begin immediately and will include the installation of a 9-a-side 3g pitch .
together we have now put in place the security of the football club and with us being in existence for 71 years we are proud that the club will still be around in a 100 years ' time .
the football club now boasts 26 teams who will all benefit the new facilities .

documents.title: sky blues pre season defeat
text: not a great night for the sky blues who were beaten at oakwell last night 3-1 .
the team took on barnsley in a preseason friendly .
stuart beavon scored city 's only goal
report : barnsley 3-1 # ccfc - # skyblues defeated at oakwell .
# pusb
sack robins
where can i find highlights of the game
oh dear !
not that pre-season results count for much but we always seem to lose friendlies , and then the mood carries on into the season
still feel were missing a new winger and attacking midfielder
author: Tom Cooke
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: college creates sensory garden for deaf people
text: students on the prince 's trust team programme at warwickshire college have helped adults who are deaf by rasing money for and creating an outdoor sensory garden .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: woman questioned on sus of over terror offences
text: an 18-year-old woman from coventry continues to be questioned after she was arrested on sus of terror offences yesterday .
she is suspected of being concerned in the commission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism .
west midlands counter terrorism unit say the arrest was pre-planned and there was no risk to the public .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: thundery showers pushing north early this morning , with some bright , warm and humid sunshine elsewhere .
further heavy thunderstorms are possible in the afternoon , with a risk of hail , strong winds and torrential downpours , mainly across north counties .
highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: wednesday : live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .

documents.title: teenager held over terror offences
text: teenager held over terror offences

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for tuesday - join us again from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: children 's centre support 'made me feel normal again '
text: kate cooper was among several mums carrying babies to a protest against proposed closures of children 's centres across warwickshire .
ms cooper ( left ) said a warwick centre had been an invaluable source of support following the birth of her second child .
`` i was finding it really difficult , '' she said .
`` i was n't really going out . ''
then she saw a letter about services at westgate children 's centre .
ms cooper has since been taking both her sons to a weekly `` tiny treasures '' session .
`` talking to people in the same boat just made me feel normal again for the first time in many weeks . ''
her friend laura humphries ( centre ) praised the work and commitment of support staff and services such as free counselling and the regular dads ' group .
warwickshire county council has begun a public consultation exercise on `` remodelling '' its children 's centres .
under proposals , 27 in a total of 39 would close .

documents.title: burglar who stole from kenilworth dentists jailed
text: a burglar who forced his way into the staff room of a kenilworth dental practice while his accomplice distracted the receptionist by booking an appointment has been jailed .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: coventry sphinx sign 25-year lease
text: the future of coventry sphinx has been secured after they agreed a new 25-year lease at sphinx drive .
the agreement will see work to improve the ground begin immediately , and include the installation of a nine-a-side pitch .
club statement : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: watch : a stormy 50-second weather forecast
text: a band of heavy thundery showers will push northwards with a risk of hail .
some places staying dry , but where thunderstorms occur there could be some torrential downpours and frequent lightning .
lows of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: coventry teen arrested on sus of terror offences
text: an 18-year-old coventry woman has been arrested today on sus of terrorism offences , west midlands police says .
according to the force , she was arrested `` on sus of being concerned in the commission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism '' .
a spokesperson said the arrest was pre-planned and intelligence-led and there was no risk to the public .
she is being questioned by west midlands counter terrorism unit at a police station in the west midlands .

documents.title: sisu likely to appeal court ruling
text: coventry city owners sisu have until the end of friday july 21 to appeal against their latest court defeat .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: thunderstorms warning
text: two weather warnings for the west midlands have been issued by the met office .
thundery showers are expected across the south of the region , including herefordshire , worcestershire and parts of warwickshire , from 17:00 today .
just after midnight they are expected to turn into scattered thunderstorms , with intense downpours affecting the whole region .
in both cases the met office says there is a chance of localised flooding .
yellow warnings for thundery downpours in places today and tomorrow # thunder and # lightning likely for some
why is it difficult to predict exactly where # thunderstorms will be ?
watch this video to find out # thunder # lightning

do n't forget the number to call for power cuts is 08003163105 or simply 105
take her into the wind mr christian
how about tomorrow in high wycombe from 8-3 ?
could do with some rain

documents.title: hs2 route moves away from austrey
text: resident groups and campaigners in the north warwickshire village of austrey say they 're relieved by the announcement hs2 wo n't be cutting through the area .
the high speed rail link was due to cross appleby hill , but the route announced by hs2 ltd now shows the line moving away from the village .
north warwickshire mp craig tracey ( who has voted against the project , described it as `` very positive news for residents in the village '' .

documents.title: coventry mp on offensive over youth unemployment
text: the mp for coventry south says the government is not doing enough to ease youth unemployment .
labour 's jim cunningham said cuts to further education budgets in coventry and cities like it were not helping .
`` how does the minister expect to reduce youth unemployment when they 've cut the further education budgets across the country and particularly in coventry , which has been cut by 27 % ? ''
he said in parliament .
the treasury minister stephen barclay said `` record numbers '' were going to university .

documents.title: burst water main on a422 affecting traffic
text: traffic on the a422 in stratford-upon-avon is being affected by a burst water pipe .
police say the road , close to goldicote hall , is flooded .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid are at a water leak on the a422 with @ twitterid just past # goldicotehall.watch your speed-road is flooded !
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: police appeal after break-in at property near tamworth
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a break-in at a property in polesworth .
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: sky blues in pre-season action
text: the sky blues meet barnsley tonight in a pre-season friendly , with kick-off at 19:45 at oakwell .
the # skyblues are in pre-season action tonight , with a 7:45pm kick-off against barnsley at oakwell # pusb
hi , will you be covering the game with commentary ?
hi lee .
no , there will be updates via twitter # pusb
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: lift fall warwick engineer inquest
text: an inquest will be held next week into the death of an engineer who fell down a lift shaft in warwick .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: bicycle theft and vehicle crime top for offences unsolved by west mids force
text: most vehicle crimes investigated by west midlands police go unsolved , according to bbc research .
the bbc has analysed 18 million crimes over a five-year period across 43 police forces , gauging which type of offence had the highest rates of no suspects being identified .
the analysis focused on cases that were closed because of that outcome .
in two types of offence , the west midlands force performed more poorly than any other english and welsh force - bicycle theft and vehicle crime .
no suspects were identified in , respectively , 93 % and 85 % of cases .

documents.title: man to stand trial over incident at sikh temple in leamington
text: a man accused of ripping up a laminated sign during a protest against a mixed-faith wedding being held at leamington 's sikh temple is to stand trial at birmingham crown court .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: the pigeon that went back to school
text: the pigeon that went back to school

documents.title: tributes paid to fatal crash teenagers
text: tributes paid to fatal crash teenagers

documents.title: the pigeon that went back to school
text: a racing pigeon spotted in a school corridor was set free by staff , only for it to return the next day and peck on the window .
the bird at whoberley hall primary school in coventry has since been nicknamed percy and is a hit with the pupils .
its overseas owner has been identified and a collection is due .
in the meantime , pupils are looking after their feathered friend .

documents.title: road re-opened following collapsed power cable
text: the a46 between stratford road and birmingham road has being re-opened following a collapsed power cable .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: protesters gather over cuts to children 's centres
text: protesters have gathered outside shire hall to highlight plans to close 27 of warwickshire 's 39 children 's centres .
petitions against the plans that would see the 12 remaining sites become `` family hubs '' have attracted about 3,000 signatures .
councillors will discuss the plans at a meeting today .
around 20 people outside @ twitterid protesting against potential closure of up to 27 children 's centres across the county @ twitterid

documents.title: victim of town centre 'altercation ' named
text: victim of town centre 'altercation ' named

documents.title: man who died in nuneaton 'altercation ' named
text: the man who died following an `` altercation '' in nuneaton has been named as peter spiers who was from the town .
the 66 year old died on saturday in market place , police say .
a post mortem carried out yesterday was inconclusive .
a 46-year-old man , arrested on sus of murder , has been bailed while investigations continue .

documents.title: nspcc issues warning over home-alone kids
text: the nspcc has referred to police and children 's services in coventry 66 cases of children being left home alone , according to its latest figures .
the children 's charity said specialist counsellors manning its 24-hour helpline made the referrals last year , up from 38 in 2015/16 .
the nspcc says leaving children at home without adult supervision puts them at greater risk of accident or injury .
the charity offers this advice for parents .

documents.title: builders hop to rabbits ' rescue
text: a rabbit and her five babies are recovering after being rescued from a building site in warwickshire .
builders called the rspca to up the animals from a site in church walk , atherstone , on monday 10 july .
rspca officer cara gibbon said : `` the mum had managed to bury herself underneath some woodwork which was part of a structure of a new house .
as soon as i saw her i could also make out her tiny babies .
they are adorable . ''
she added : `` there is a chance that the rabbit is an escaped pet and we would love to reunite her with her family , if so . ''

documents.title: college pays tribute to students killed in atherstone crash
text: two of the teenagers killed in a car crash near atherstone on sunday have been named by their college as ryan barber and trudi-mae kennell .

a statement issued by north warwickshire and south leicestershire college confirmed they studied at the nuneaton campus - ryan as an apprentice on day release and trudi-mae a student of sport and exercise science .
marion plant , principal , described trudi-mae as a `` lovely girl '' and `` model student '' and said : `` she was always smiling and will be very much missed . ''
of ryan , she said : `` like trudi-mae he was very popular . ''
the college has opened a book of condolence .
a third teenager died when the car in which they were travelling hit a tree on sunday afternoon , with a fourth occupant left with injuries thought to be non life-threatening .

documents.title: £ 7m to create new homes at site of torched wood end education centre
text: the site of a learning centre destroyed by fire is set to be given a new lease of life thanks to a £ 7million investment .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: world para-athletics championships : bronze for kare adenegan
text: coventry wheelchair racer kare adenegan has won a bronze medal in the t34 800m at the world para-athletics championships .
it follows her success in the 100m on friday .
teammate hannah cockroft was first in the t34 800m and can complete a treble with victory in the 400m .

documents.title: driver in court after head-on crash left woman with life threatening injuries
text: the trial of a man accused of causing a head-on crash which left a young kenilworth woman with life-threatening injuries can not take place until early next year .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: vigil to remember three killed in atherstone crash
text: police closed a road in atherstone last night to allow family and friends of three people killed in a car crash to hold a vigil .
a total of four people were in a bmw car driving in the common in baxterley when it hit a tree on sunday afternoon .
two men , aged 18 and 19 , and an 18-year-old woman died and a fourth passenger suffered injuries which are not thought to be life-threatening .
a woman has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: another warm day in store with the possibility of sunny spells and highs of 26c ( 79f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry and warwickshire live team .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's all for monday - join us again from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: leamington roadworks to last seven weeks
text: motorists in leamington spa are being warned to expect delays as seven weeks of roadworks begin today on one of the town 's main streets - to renew old gas mains .
the ageing iron pipes in regent street are being replaced by ones made from a plastic , said to last eighty years .
the road will stay open , but there 'll be temporary traffic lights at the junction with portland street .
the junction with bedford street will be closed .

documents.title: travellers in the midlands : 'a game of cat and mouse '
text: the bbc has learned that since 2014 , councils across the west midlands have spent more than £ 900,000 on legal costs and clean-up operations associated with travellers ' illegal camps .
i 've been filming in wolverhampton , staffordshire and herefordshire to see how a game of cat and mouse is being played out .
local authorities are trying to preserve public spaces while traveller groups are demanding they do more to provide permanent pitches .
see more on this story on bbc midlands today at 18:30 .
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man remanded in custody following string of sex attacks in walsgrave
text: a man has been charged following a series of sexual assaults in walsgrave last month .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: anniversary parade for ammunition depot
text: to celebrate the 75th anniversary of kineton munition depot , soldiers and officers will conduct a freedom parade in warwick on 22 july .
troops from the warwickshire army base that trains bomb disposal experts were given the freedom of warwick in 2012 .
demss kineton is the largest munitions depot in europe and trains up to 600 bomb disposal experts each year .
the parade will begin at 10:00 from warwick castle and end at pageant gardens .

documents.title: cian harries moves to swansea city
text: sky blues defender cian harris has joined premier league side swansea city for an undisclosed fee , the club said .
the 20-year-old academy graduate made 17 appearances for coventry city .

documents.title: watch : tonight and tomorrow 's weather forecast
text: after a fine , sunny day for most of us today , here 's how the next 24-hours is looking for the west midlands .
you can keep up-to-date with the latest forecasts for your area via the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: man charged with child sex offences
text: man charged with child sex offences

documents.title: friends remember 'genuinely lovely people ' killed in atherstone crash
text: messages of condolence , toys and flowers have been left at the site of a crash in atherstone in which three teenagers died .
a total of four people were in a bmw car , driving in the common in baxterley , when it hit a tree at about 16:40 on sunday .
friends say they 've been left `` speechless '' at the loss of `` such genuinely lovely people '' .
a woman has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .
the three who died have not been formally named by police .

documents.title: university launches bee identification app
text: a surveying app has been launched by coventry university which , it hopes , will allow users to identify bumblebee species and record which flowers they visit .
researcher hope the `` blooms for bees '' app will help build a detailed of certain species ' decline in the uk .

documents.title: three teenagers killed in fatal crash
text: three teenagers killed in fatal crash

documents.title: man charged with historical sex offences
text: a rugby man has been charged with a series of sexual offences against children in the 1990s and 2000s , police say .
according to the warwickshire force , the charges faced by douglas miller , 56 , pertain to three individuals .
he is due to appear at warwickshire magistrates court on 16 august .

documents.title: woman arrested over fatal atherstone crash
text: an 18-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving following a crash near atherstone yesterday in which three people were killed .
they died at the scene when the bmw in which they were travelling hit a tree .
the arrested woman was travelling in another vehicle , police say .
she has been released under investigation .
according to the warwickshire force , the crash happened on the common , between merevale lane and waste lane .
an 18-year-old man travelling in the car in which the three died was taken to hospital .
he is being treated for injuries not believed to be life-threatening .

documents.title: three men charged with series of burglaries
text: three men have been charged in connection with a series of burglaries in the nuneaton area , police say .
the men were arrested on friday afternoon in bedworth after a short police pursuit .
the burglaries all took place on 13 and 14 of july in nuneaton , bedworth and bulkington .

documents.title: coventry university appoints its first female chancellor
text: coventry university 's new chancellor has been named as margaret casely-hayford - the first woman to hold the ambassadorial post .

ms casely-hayford , the current chair of international development at charity action aid uk , says the university `` shares my commitment to equality of opportunity and i will be shouting out coventry 's message that a university can be world-class while admitting talented students from a range of backgrounds . ''
she was the first black woman in the uk to be made a partner at a city law firm .
a freeman of the city of london , she also serves on the metropolitan police oversight panel and spent eight years as a government-appointed trustee of great ormond st children 's hospital charity .

documents.title: nearly 2,000 drug-driving arrests since change in law
text: since changes to drug-driving laws in march 2015 , police in the west mercia and warwickshire areas have arrested 1,834 drivers in connection with the offences .
there was a clear increase in 2016 , when 895 arrests were made across the two force areas and there have been 569 made in the first six months of this year .
nearly 85 % of those arrests were made in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .

documents.title: sensory garden to aid patient rehabilitation
text: patients who have suffered a stroke , brain injury or tumour are among those to benefit from a new hospital garden to help with physical rehabilitation .
obstacles in the garden , at the leamington spa hospital , are designed to simulate everyday hazards around the home .
a similar scheme in the netherlands recorded a 46 % reduction in the number of falls among patients who completed the programme .
work to expand leamington hospital 's falls garden is completed !
the new space will help patients to regain their confidence and independence

documents.title: robber jailed after snatching 87-year-old pensioner 's purse
text: a housing association lift engineer has been commended by a judge for bravely chasing and tackling to the ground a dangerous robber who had snatched a vulnerable pensioner 's purse .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: west midlands 'among the worst for puppy farming '
text: the west midlands has among the highest reports of puppy farms in england .
new figures released by the rspca show that 2016 was its busiest year for tackling the underground puppy trade .
the charity says it 's receiving more calls than ever from people reporting questionable breeders and dealers .
the charity 's findings also show that french bulldogs ( are the most searched-for breed for sale online .

documents.title: sky blues in pre-season training
text: coventry city have returned from their open training session in spain and are back at their ryton ground preparing for tomorrow night 's pre-season friendly against barnsley .
city will also face mickleover sports on tuesday 25 july at the don amott arena in derbyshire .
more pre-season action on a sunny morning at ryton !
# pusb

documents.title: coming up on midlands today : latest on fatal crash in atherstone
text: on midlands today at 13:30 we 'll be reporting from the scene of a crash in which three young people lost their lives .
the bmw they were travelling in left the road and is believed to have hit a tree near atherstone .
another teenager , a rear seat passenger , was taken to hospital suffering neck , chest and abdominal injuries .

documents.title: vacuum cleaner attack man jailed
text: a kenilworth man who left a peacemaker needing nine stitches in a wound to his head after attacking him with the tube from a vacuum cleaner , has been jailed .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: flooding warning with thunderstorms forecast this week
text: two weather warnings for the west midlands have been issued by the met office today .
firstly they say thundery showers are expected across the south of the region , including herefordshire , worcestershire and parts of warwickshire , from tomorrow evening .
then from just after midnight on wednesday they are expected to turn into scattered thunderstorms affecting the whole region .
in both cases the met office says there is a chance of localised flooding where they hit .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: world para athletics championships : kare adenegan competes for second medal
text: coventry wheelchair athlete kare adenegan will try to win her second medal of the world para athletics championships later today .
the 16 year old , from coventry godiva harriers club , won silver in the t34 100 metres race on friday night in london , with hannah cockroft taking gold .
tonight she goes in the t34 800 metres final .
her fellow club member ben rowlings will also compete on the track in the t34 400 metres final .

documents.title: inspirational coventry youngster made guest of honour at a party
text: a youngster from coventry , who had faced cancer twice by the tender age of four , was a guest of honour at a party honouring the strength of children and young people diagnosed with the disease .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: the cost to councils of traveller encampments
text: more than £ 900,000 has been spent by midlands councils dealing with sites used illegally by travellers in the last three years .
figures obtained by the bbc show that the sum since 2014 has been spent on legal fees and clean-up operations .
author: Joanne Malin
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hs2 : contracts awarded
text: the winners of £ 6.6bn worth of contracts to build the first phase of hs2 between london and birmingham through warwickshire have been announced by the government .
uk companies carillion , costain and balfour beatty are among the consortia who will build tunnels , bridges and embankments on the first stretch of the new high speed rail line .
the contracts will support 16,000 jobs .
the final routes of the manchester and leeds branches of hs2 are due to be announced later .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: murder investigation after fatal 'altercation '
text: a murder investigation has been launched after a man died following an `` altercation '' in nuneaton , police say .
warwickshire police said it was called to harefield road on saturday at 13:05 .
a man in his 60s was taken to hospital where he later died .
a 46-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder after being originally arrested on sus of assault .
detectives are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: fourth man injured in atherstone crash that killed three
text: more now on the fatal crash in atherstone we 've been telling you about
one person was taken to hospital suffering neck , chest and abdominal injuries after a car crashed into a tree , killing three people , the ambulance service said .
the man , who was a rear seat passenger in the vehicle , was taken to university hospital in coventry .
two men aged 18 and 19 were killed , along with an 18-year-old woman .
they died at the scene of the collision on the common in baxterley at about 16:40 on sunday .

documents.title: plans for more than 600 nuneaton homes branded 'overdevelopment '
text: a councillor has quit his role on the planning committee to fight plans for hundreds of new homes in nuneaton .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: three teenagers die in atherstone crash
text: three people were killed when the car they were travelling in left the road and hit a tree in atherstone yesterday , police say .
two men aged 18 and 19 and a woman aged 18 died at the scene of the incident on the common in baxterley , at about 16:40 .
warwickshire police said it was still at the `` very early stages '' of its investigation and urged any witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a slightly cooler start to the day , it will be warm and sunny with plenty of sunshine and highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry and warwickshire live team .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
